intro: Lithocardium canescens, commonly known as the silverleaf stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, gray-green leaves that are covered in a powdery coating. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink during the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Lithocardium canescens is often used in rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
